key_points: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene introduced a bill to grant Kyle Rittenhouse the Congressional Gold Medal.
The bill claims Rittenhouse deserves the honor for 'protecting the community of Kenosha' during a 'Black Lives Matter riot'.
The bill is unlikely to pass due to the need for two-thirds co-sponsorship in a House controlled by Democrats, many of whom have criticized Rittenhouse.
Greene has been a vocal supporter of Rittenhouse, commending his actions and celebrating his acquittal on social media.
Rep. Matt Gaetz's spokesperson commented that awarding Rittenhouse the medal could inflate his ego during a potential internship with Gaetz.
Kyle Rittenhouse was found not guilty of intentional and reckless homicide after killing two men at a protest in Kenosha.
Rittenhouse argued he was in Kenosha to protect local businesses with a rifle and medic kit, while prosecutors said he incited violence.
The verdict received mixed reactions, with conservatives praising it and liberals denouncing it as a miscarriage of justice.
Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wisc.) supported the jury's decision, contrasting with Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's (D-N.Y.) criticism.
